AOP entity (KE/KER): KE: Goblet cells, increased (Event 6); KE: Mucin, increased (Event 9); KER: EGFR activation → Goblet cells ↑ → Mucin ↑
Input (manipulation / sample): Human airway epithelial cells; rodent tracheal models; EGF or TGF-α stimulation
Method / Assay (SOP notes): Mucin gene expression by RT-PCR or Northern blot (MUC5AC, MUC5B). Mucin protein quantification by ELISA or dot blot. Histological staining for mucin (Alcian Blue, PAS staining). Immunohistochemistry for Muc5AC protein. Goblet cell enumeration in tissue sections.
Output / Measurement: MUC5AC and MUC5B mRNA levels; Mucin protein concentration (µg/mL); Alcian Blue/PAS-positive goblet cell counts; Muc5AC immunostaining intensity; Dose-response to EGFR agonists
Interpretation / Context fields to captu: Cell or tissue type; species; EGF/TGF-α concentration; stimulation duration; RT-PCR primers; ELISA antibody specifics; histological staining protocol; microscopy and quantification method; normalization approach; replicate number
Exemplar peer-reviewed manuscripts: Takeyama K, Dabbagh K, Lee HM, Agustí C, Lausier JA, Ueki IF, Grattan KM, Nadel JA. (1999). Epidermal growth factor system regulates mucin production in airways. Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A. 96(6):3081-6.
Protocol / SOP notes (attach): Include EGF/TGF-α dosing, RT-PCR or Northern blot protocol, mucin ELISA procedure, histological processing and staining (Alcian Blue/PAS, immunohistochemistry), image analysis for goblet cell counting, quantification methods
S&T considerations (ontology / mapping): Biolink: MeasurementProcess; OBI: RT-PCR, ELISA, histology; Mapping: KE goblet cell increase (Event 6), KE mucin increase (Event 9), KER EGFR → goblet → mucin; Gene: MUC5AC, MUC5B; EGFR pathway

KE / Domain: Goblet cell differentiation from FoxJ1+ progenitors
AOP entity (KE/KER): KE: Goblet cells, increased (Event 6); FoxJ1-expressing progenitor cells give rise to goblet cells in human airway
Input (manipulation / sample): Primary human airway epithelial cells at ALI; lineage tracing; differentiation time-course
Method / Assay (SOP notes): Immunofluorescence for goblet cell markers (Muc5AC) and FoxJ1. Dual-labeling to track progenitor-to-goblet cell transition. Confocal microscopy and cell quantification. Histology with Alcian Blue/PAS staining. Time-course analysis of differentiation. Cell type ratio quantification.
Output / Measurement: Percentage of Muc5AC+ goblet cells; Percentage of FoxJ1+ cells; Goblet cell to ciliated cell ratio; Time-course of goblet cell appearance; Lineage relationship data
Interpretation / Context fields to captu: Donor characteristics; passage number; differentiation medium; days at ALI; sampling timepoints; antibodies for immunofluorescence; staining protocols; confocal imaging parameters; cell counting methodology; statistical analysis
Exemplar peer-reviewed manuscripts: Turner et al. (2012). Goblet cells are derived from a FoxJ1-expressing progenitor in a human airway epithelium. Dev Cell. 22(4):821-9.
Protocol / SOP notes (attach): Include ALI differentiation protocol, immunofluorescence dual-staining procedure, confocal imaging settings, cell classification and counting criteria, time-course experimental design, lineage analysis approach
S&T considerations (ontology / mapping): Biolink: MeasurementProcess; OBI: immunofluorescence assay; Mapping: KE goblet cell increase, developmental origin; Gene: FOXJ1, MUC5AC; Cell lineage; Differentiation dynamics

KE / Domain: Goblet cell hyperplasia and mucin secretion (contemporary)
AOP entity (KE/KER): KE: Goblet cells, increased (Event 6); KE: Mucin, increased (Event 9); in vitro and in vivo models
Input (manipulation / sample): Primary human airway epithelial cells at ALI; in vivo rodent models; environmental or inflammatory stimuli
Method / Assay (SOP notes): Multi-modal goblet cell and mucin assessment. Histology with Alcian Blue/PAS for goblet cells. Immunofluorescence for Muc5AC and Muc5B proteins. qRT-PCR for MUC gene expression. Mucin ELISA in apical secretions or tissue homogenates. High-content imaging and automated quantification.
Output / Measurement: Goblet cell count and percentage; Mucin gene expression (MUC5AC, MUC5B); Mucin protein levels in secretions; Muc5AC/B immunofluorescence intensity; Automated high-content analysis metrics
Interpretation / Context fields to captu: Model system (in vitro ALI, in vivo); donor/animal characteristics; exposure or stimulation conditions; tissue processing; histology protocols; antibodies; qRT-PCR primers and normalization; ELISA platform; imaging system and analysis software; replicate number
Exemplar peer-reviewed manuscripts: Le et al. (2025). [Goblet cell and mucin regulation].
Protocol / SOP notes (attach): Document tissue processing and staining, immunofluorescence protocol, qRT-PCR methods, ELISA procedures, high-content imaging workflow, automated analysis algorithms, quality control measures
S&T considerations (ontology / mapping): Biolink: MeasurementProcess; OBI: histology, immunofluorescence, qRT-PCR, ELISA; Mapping: KE goblet cells ↑, KE mucin ↑; Gene: MUC5AC, MUC5B; Multi-modal integration

KE / Domain: Goblet cell and mucin assessment (toxicology endpoint)
AOP entity (KE/KER): KE: Goblet cells, increased (Event 6); KE: Mucin, increased (Event 9); response to tobacco product exposures
Input (manipulation / sample): MucilAir™ 3D bronchial epithelial model at ALI; 28-day repeated exposure to heated tobacco aerosol or cigarette smoke
Method / Assay (SOP notes): Histological assessment of goblet cells using Alcian Blue staining. Immunohistochemistry for Muc5AC protein. Quantification of goblet cell numbers and mucin staining intensity. Morphological evaluation of epithelial architecture. Correlation with other endpoints (cilia, inflammation).
Output / Measurement: Goblet cell count per field; Percentage of Alcian Blue-positive cells; Muc5AC staining intensity and distribution; Changes over 28-day exposure period; Correlation with functional impairment
Interpretation / Context fields to captu: 3D culture model (MucilAir™); donor information; days at ALI; exposure regimen (dose, duration, frequency); tissue fixation and processing; staining protocols (Alcian Blue, Muc5AC IHC); imaging parameters; quantification method; baseline comparison; replicate number
Exemplar peer-reviewed manuscripts: Chapman et al. (2023). Twenty-eight day repeated exposure of human 3D bronchial epithelial model to heated tobacco aerosols indicates decreased toxicological responses compared to cigarette smoke. Toxicol Rep.
Protocol / SOP notes (attach): Include tissue processing workflow, Alcian Blue staining protocol, Muc5AC immunohistochemistry procedure, imaging acquisition, quantification methodology, quality control for staining consistency, integration with other toxicology endpoints
S&T considerations (ontology / mapping): Biolink: MeasurementProcess; OBI: histology, immunohistochemistry; Mapping: KE goblet cells ↑, KE mucin ↑; Toxicology assessment; Repeated exposure model; Multi-endpoint integration

KE / Domain: Mucin and goblet cell multi-endpoint analysis
AOP entity (KE/KER): KE: Goblet cells, increased (Event 6); KE: Mucin, increased (Event 9); comprehensive epithelial assessment
Input (manipulation / sample): MucilAir™ 3D airway epithelium at ALI; e-cigarette aerosol or cigarette smoke exposure
Method / Assay (SOP notes): Integrated assessment of goblet cell and mucin endpoints. Histology (Alcian Blue/H&E). Immunohistochemistry for Muc5AC. Gene expression analysis for mucin genes. Cell type balance assessment (goblet vs ciliated cell ratio). Functional correlation with mucociliary clearance.
Output / Measurement: Goblet cell percentage; Mucin gene expression; Muc5AC protein levels; Goblet-to-ciliated cell ratio; Integration with MCT and other functional endpoints
Interpretation / Context fields to captu: Culture model; exposure conditions; histology and immunostaining protocols; gene expression methods; imaging and quantification approaches; cell type classification criteria; functional assay correlation; replicate design
Exemplar peer-reviewed manuscripts: Czekala et al. (2021). Multi-endpoint analysis of human 3D airway epithelium following repeated exposure to whole electronic vapor product aerosol or cigarette smoke.
Protocol / SOP notes (attach): Document comprehensive protocol covering histology, IHC, gene expression, cell type quantification, and integration of morphological and functional data; quality metrics for each endpoint
S&T considerations (ontology / mapping): Biolink: MeasurementProcess; OBI: multiple assay types; Mapping: KE goblet cells ↑, KE mucin ↑; Multi-endpoint systems approach; Cell type balance; Functional integration

AOP entity (KE/KER): KE: Mucin, increased (Event 9); transcriptomic assessment of mucin gene family

Method / Assay (SOP notes): RNA-seq for genome-wide expression including mucin gene family (MUC1, MUC4, MUC5AC, MUC5B, MUC16, etc.). Differential expression analysis. Gene set enrichment for mucin-related pathways. qRT-PCR validation of key mucin genes. Correlation with protein-level mucin data.

Interpretation / Context fields to captu: Culture model; exposure protocol; RNA extraction and QC; sequencing platform and depth; bioinformatics workflow; differential expression criteria; pathway databases; validation gene selection; normalization method; batch correction
Exemplar peer-reviewed manuscripts: Haswell et al. (2017). Reduced biological effect of e-cigarette aerosol compared to cigarette smoke evaluated in vitro using normalized nicotine dose and RNA-seq-based toxicogenomics.

S&T considerations (ontology / mapping): Biolink: MeasurementProcess; OBI: RNA-seq assay; Mapping: KE mucin increase; Gene: MUC5AC, MUC5B, mucin gene family; Transcriptomics; Multi-omics integration potential
